node1.speaker: Passenger
node1.text: The passenger looks out the window and smiles. 'So, what do you think about train rides?'

choices.text: I think they’re relaxing. What about you?
Honestly, they can be a bit boring sometimes.

node2.speaker: Passenger
node2.text: They nod, leaning back. 'Yeah, they’re kind of soothing, aren’t they? Just the sound of the tracks and the scenery flying by.'

choices.text: Exactly! It’s a nice way to clear your head.
Sometimes I lose track of time staring out the window.

node3.speaker: Passenger
node3.text: They chuckle. 'Fair enough. I guess not everyone finds them exciting. What do you do to pass the time?'

choices.text: I usually bring a book or listen to music.
Mostly just stare out the window. It’s kind of mesmerizing.

node4.speaker: Passenger
node4.text: They smile warmly. 'Yeah, it’s like a little escape, isn’t it? I don’t even mind when it’s a long trip.'

choices.text: Exactly. It’s like time slows down a bit.

node5.speaker: Passenger
node5.text: They laugh softly. 'Right? It’s like the world becomes a giant movie screen.'

choices.text: Yeah, and every scene is different.

node6.speaker: Passenger
node6.text: They nod thoughtfully. 'Good choices. Music and books definitely help the time fly.'

choices.text: Do you have a favorite book or playlist for train rides?

node7.speaker: Passenger
node7.text: They grin. 'Same here. There’s something so calming about watching the world blur by.'

choices.text: Especially when the light hits just right.

node8.speaker: Passenger
node8.text: They light up. 'Oh, absolutely. For books, I like thrillers—makes the calm of the train feel like the perfect backdrop.'

choices.text: That’s an interesting contrast. Thrills in a peaceful setting.

node9.speaker: Passenger
node9.text: They glance out the window, their tone reflective. 'Yeah, especially during sunrise or sunset. It’s like nature showing off.'

choices.text: It’s moments like that that make me love train rides.
